snippet: Technological advances are helping refine tools for hearing in less-than-ideal circumstances.
abstract: Anne Eisenberg Novelties column features technological advances that are helping refine tools for people who are hard of hearing in less-than-ideal circumstances, especially when there is a lot of ambient noise; notes in-ear earphones and an iPhone app that amplifies and processes sound. Photos (M)
lead_paragraph: DIGITAL hearing aids can do wonders for faded hearing. But other devices can help, too, as audio technology adds new options to help people converse at a noisy restaurant, or talk quietly with a pharmacist at a crowded drugstore counter. Richard Einhorn, a composer who suddenly lost much of his hearing two years ago, relies on his hearing aid, of course, for general use. But when he is meeting friends at a busy coffee shop -- where his hearing aid is not always good at distinguishing their voices amid the clatter -- he removes it. He has a better solution.

headline.main: For Hard of Hearing, Clarity Out of the Din
